cms_articles.title: Publications
cms_articles.text:
Adams, G. W. (2008) Rome and the social role of élite villas in its suburbs (Oxford 2008).

Aicher, P. J. (1995) Guide to the aqueducts of ancient Rome (Wauconda 1995).

Albers, J. (2013) Campus Martius: die urbane Entwicklung des Marsfeldes von der Republik bis zur mittleren Kaiserzeit (Wiesbaden 2013).

Allen, P. M. (1997) Cities and regions as self-organizing systems: models of complexity (Amsterdam 1997).

Allen, P. M. and Sanglier, M. (1981) "Urban evolution, self-organization, and decision making", Environment and Planning A 13 (1981) 167-83.

Almusaed, A. and Almssad, A. (2020) "City phenomenon between urban structure and composition", in Sustainability in urban planning and design, ed. Almusaed, A., Almssad, A. and Truong-Hong, L. (London 2020).

Annibaletto, M. (2010) Oltre la città: il suburbio nel mondo romano (Rubano 2010).

Ashby, T. (1935) The aqueducts of ancient Rome (Oxford 1935).

Bassani, M. (2012) "Sacra privata nella campagna romana. Prospettive di ricerca", Ostraka 21 (2012) 5-30.

Bianco, R. (2019) "Il suburbio di Roma: confini e luoghi di culto", in I confini di Roma: atti del convegno internazionale (Università degli Studi di Ferrara, 31 maggio - 2 giugno 2018), ed. Dubbini, R. (Pisa 2019) 107-20.

Bianco, R., Galli, M. and Ippoliti, M. (2020) "Roman praedia as places of ritual practices", Bullettino della Commissione archeologica comunale di Roma 121 (2020) 187–205.

Bodel, J. (2017) "Roman tomb gardens", in Gardens of the Roman Empire, ed. Malek, A.-A., Gleason, K. L., Hartswick, K. J. and Jashemski, W. F. (Cambridge 2017) 177-95.

Bonetto, J., Camporeale, S. and Pizzo, A. (2014) (ed.) Arqueología de la Construcción IV. Las canteras en el mundo antiguo (Merida 2014).

Borbonus, D. (2014) Columbarium tombs and collective identity in Augustan Rome (New York, NY 2014).

Borg, B. E. (2013) Crisis and ambition: tombs and burial customs in third-century AD Rome (Oxford 2013).

--- (2019a) Roman tombs and the art of commemoration: contextual approaches to funerary customs in the second century CE (Cambridge 2019).

--- (2019b) "Herodes Atticus in Rome: the Triopion reconsidered", in Visual histories of the classical world ed. Draycott, C. M., Raja, R., Welch, K. and Wootton, W. T. (Turnhout 2019) 317-30.

--- (2020) "Does religion matter? Life, death, and interaction in the Roman suburbium", in Lived religion in the ancient Mediterranean world: approaching religious transformations from archaeology, history and classics, ed. Gasparini, V., Patzelt, M., Raja, R., Rieger, A.-K., Rüpke, J. and Urciuoli, E. (Berlin 2020) 405-34.

--- (forthcoming) "Peter and Paul ad catacumbas: a pozzolana mine reconsidered", in The Economy of death: New research on collective burial spaces in Rome from the late republican to the late roman period. Proceedings of the 19th International Congress of Classical Archaeology, Cologne/Bonn 2018, ed. Fröhlich, T. and Zimmermann, N. (Heidelberg forthcoming). For the accepted version, see http://hdl.handle.net/10871/126727

--- (in prep.) Christians and Jews on the Appian Way: a micro-historical approach to ethnic diversity in imperial Rome (in prep.).

Bowman, A. K. and Wilson, A. (2011) Settlement, urbanization, and population (Oxford 2011).

Broekaert, W. and Zuiderhoek, A. (2013) "Industries and services", in The Cambridge companion to ancient Rome, ed. Erdkamp, P. (Cambridge 2013) 317-35.

Bruun, C. (2015) "The major corpora and epigraphic publications", in The Oxford handbook of Roman epigraphy, ed. Bruun, C. and Edmondson, J. (Oxford 2015) 66–77.

Bukowiecki, E., Volpe, R. and Wulf-Rheidt, U. (2016) (ed.) Il laterizio nei cantieri imperiali. roma e il mediterraneo. Atti del 1 workshop 'Laterizio' (Sesto Fiorentino 2016).

Buonocore, M. (2015) "Epigraphic research from its inception: The contribution of manuscripts", in The Oxford handbook of Roman epigraphy, ed. Bruun, C. and Edmondson, J. (Oxford 2015) 21-41.

Calabi Limentani, I. (2010) Scienza epigrafica: contributi alla storia degli studi di epigrafia latina (Faenza 2010).

Cappelletti, S. (2006) The Jewish community of Rome: from the second century B.C. to the third century C.E (Leiden 2006).

Carafa, P. (2000) "Una nuova analisi archeologica per il settore settentrionale del Suburbio di Roma", Bullettino della Commissione archeologica comunale di Roma 101 (2000) 185-96.

Carandini, A., Carafa, P. and Campbell Halavais, A. (2017) The atlas of ancient Rome: biography and portraits of the city (Princeton; Oxford 2017).

Chandler, T. (1987) Four thousand years of urban growth: an historical census (Lewiston; Lampeter 1987).

Chioffi, L. (2003) "I nomi dei proprietari dall'analisi epigrafica", in Suburbium. Il suburbio di Roma dalla crisi del sistema delle ville a Gregorio Magno, ed. Pergola, P., Santangeli Valenzani, R. and Volpe, R. (Rome 2003) 437-84.

Cima, M. and La Rocca, E. (1998) (ed.) Horti romani (Rome 1998).

Ciotoli, G., Nisio, S. and Serafini, R. (2015) "Analisi della suscettibilità ai sinkholes antropogenici nel centro urbano di Roma", Memorie Descrittive della Carta geologica d'Italia 99 (2015) 167-88.

Collar, A. (2013) Religious networks in the Roman empire: The spread of new ideas (Cambridge 2013).

Cooley, A. E. and Salway, B. (2012) "Roman Inscriptions 2006-2010", Journal of Roman Studies 102 (2012) 172-286.

Cupitò, C. (2007) Il territorio tra la via Salaria, l'Aniene, il Tevere e la via Salaria Vetus: Municipio II (Rome 2007).

De Angelis d'Ossat, G. (1943) La geologia delle catacombe romane (Vatican City 1943).

de Blois, L. and Rich, J. (2002) The transformation of economic life under the Roman Empire : proceedings of the Second Workshop of the International Network Impact of Empire (Roman Empire, c. 200 B.C.-A.D. 476), Nottingham, July 4-7, 2001 (Amsterdam 2002).

De Franceschini, M. (2005) Ville dell'Agro romano (Rome 2005).

de Ligt, L. (2012) Peasants, citizens and soldiers: Studies in the demographic history of Roman Italy 225 BC–AD 100 (Cambridge 2012).

De Marchi, L. (1887) Cave dei dintorni di Roma con carta delle ubicazioni (Rome 1887).

--- (1894) Le cave di pozzolana nei dintorni di Roma (Rome 1894).

Depauw, M. (2018) "Trismegistos: optimizing interoperability for texts from the ancient world", in Crossing experiences in digital epigraphy: from practice to discipline, ed. De Santis, A. and Rossi, I. (Warsaw 2018) 193-201.

Dey, H. W. (2011) The Aurelian Wall and the refashioning of imperial Rome, AD 271 - 855 (Cambridge 2011).

Di Giacomo, G. (2016) Oro, pietre preziose e perle: produzione e commercio a Roma (Roma 2016).

Dinuzzi, S., Fusco, U. and Pavolini, C. (2009) Il territorio tra il Tevere, l'Aniene e la via Nomentana: Municipio II, parte seconda (Roma 2009).

Dubbini, R. (2019) (ed.) I confini di Roma: atti del convegno internazionale (Università degli Studi di Ferrara, 31 maggio - 2 giugno 2018) (Pisa 2019).

Eck, W., Funke, P. and Dohnicht, M. (2014) (ed.) Öffentlichkeit - Monument - Text: XIV Congressus Internationalis Epigraphiae Graecae et Latinae 27. - 31. Augusti MMXII: Akten (Berlin; Boston 2014).

Emmerson, A. L. C. (2020) Life and death in the Roman suburb (Oxford 2020).

Faßbender, A. (2005) Untersuchungen zur Topographie von Grabstätten in Rom von der späten Republik bis in die Spätantike (PhD thesis, Cologne 2005).

Flower, H. I. (2017) The dancing lares and the serpent in the garden: religion at the Roman street corner (Princeton 2017).

Fulminante, F. The urbanization of Rome and Latium Vetus: from the Bronze Age to the Archaic Era (Cambridge 2014).

Goodman, P. (2016) "Working together: clusters of artisans in the Roman city", in Urban Craftsmen and Traders in the Roman World, ed. Wilson, A. and Flohr, M. (Oxford 2016).

Goodman, P. J. (2007) The Roman city and its periphery: from Rome to Gaul (New York, NY 2007).

--- (2020) "In omnibus regionibus? The fourteen regions and the city of Rome", Papers of the British School at Rome 88 (2020) 119-50.

Graham, A. S. (2013) "The word is not enough: a new approach to assessing monumental inscriptions. A case study from Roman Ephesos", American Journal of Archaeology 117 (2013) 383-412.

Gregori, G. L. (1987) "Horti sepulchrales e cepotaphia nelle iscrizioni urbane", Bullettino della Commissione archeologica comunale di Roma 92 (1987) 175-88.

Griesbach, J. (2007) Villen und Gräber: Siedlungs- und Bestattungsplätze der römischen Kaiserzeit im Suburbium von Rom (Rahden/Westf. 2007).

Hanson, J. W. (2016) An Urban Geography of the Roman World, 100 BC to AD 300 (Oxford 2016).

Haselberger, L. (2002) Mapping Augustan Rome (Portsmouth, R.I. 2002).

--- (2007) Urbem adornare: die Stadt Rom und ihre Gestaltumwandlung unter Augustus = Rome's urban metamorphosis under Augustus (Portsmouth, R.I. 2007).

Haug, A. and Kreuz, P.-A. (2016) Stadterfahrung als Sinneserfahrung in der römischen Kaiserzeit (Turnhout 2016).

Hesberg, H. v. (1992) Römische Grabbauten (Darmstadt 1992).

Hesberg, H. v. and Zanker, P. (1987) (ed.) Römische Gräberstraßen: Selbstdarstellung - Status - Standard (Munich 1987).

Holleran, C. (2012) Shopping in ancient Rome: the retail trade in the late Republic and the principate (Oxford 2012).

--- (2016) "Labour mobility in the Roman world: a case study of mines in Iberia", in Migration and mobility in the early Roman Empire, ed. de Ligt, L. and Tacoma, L. E. (Leiden 2016) 95-137.

Jacobs, P. W. and Conlin, D. A. (2015) Campus Martius: The Field of Mars in the life of ancient Rome (Cambridge 2015).

Jolivet, V. (2009) (ed.) Suburbium II: il suburbio di Roma dalla fine dell'età monarchica alla nascita del sistema delle ville, (V - II secolo a. c.) (Rome 2009).

Kaiser, A. (2000) The urban dialogue: an analysis of the use of space in the Roman city of Empúries, Spain (Oxford 2000).

Kleijn, G. d. (2001) The water supply of ancient Rome: city area, water, and population (Amsterdam 2001).

Kostof, S. (1991) The city shaped: urban patterns and meanings through history (London 1991).

Latteri, N. (2002) "La statio dei pretoriani al III miglio dell'Appia antica ed il loro sepolcreto "ad catacumbas"", Mélanges de l'Ecole française de Rome. Antiquité 114 (2002) 739-57.

Launaro, A. (2011) Peasants and slaves: the rural population of Roman Italy (200 BC to AD 100) (Cambridge 2011).

Laurence, R. (1994) Roman Pompeii: space and society (London 1994).

Laurence, R. and Newsome, D. J. (2011) (ed.) Rome, Ostia, Pompeii: movement and space (Oxford 2011).

Liverani, P. (2003) "L'agro Vaticano", in Suburbium. Il suburbio di Roma dalla crisi del sistema delle ville a Gregorio Magno, ed. Pergola, P., Santangeli Valenzani, R. and Volpe, R. (Rome 2003) 399-413.

Lott, J. B. (2004) The neighborhoods of Augustan Rome (Cambridge 2004).

--- (2013) "Regions and neighbourhoods", in The Cambridge companion toaAncient Rome, ed. Erdkamp, P. (Cambridge 2013) 169-89.

Manacorda, D. and Santangeli Valenzani, R. (2010) (ed.) Il primo miglio della Via Appia a Roma: atti della giornata di studio, Roma, Museo Nazionale Romano, 16 giugno 2009 (Rome 2010).

Mayer, J. W. (2005) Imus ad villam: Studien zur Villeggiatur im stadtrömischen Suburbium in der späten Republik und frühen Kaiserzeit (Stuttgart 2005).

Meneghini, R. (2007) "La cartografia antica e il catasto di Roma imperiale", in Res Bene Gestae: ricerche di storia urbana su Roma antica in onore di Eva Margareta Steinby, ed. Leone, A., Palombi, D. and Walker, S. (Rome 2007) 205-18.

Mignone, L. M. (2016) The Republican Aventine and Rome’s social order (Ann Arbor, MI 2016).

Morley, N. (1996) Metropolis and hinterland: the city of Rome and the Italian economy; 200 B.C. - A.D. 200 (Cambridge 1996).

Moroni, S., Rauws, W. and Cozzolino, S. (2020) "Forms of self-organization: Urban complexity and planning implications", Environment and Planning B 47 (2020) 287–303.

Morris, I. (2013) The measure of civilization: how social development decides the fate of nations (London 2013).

Narducci, P. (1889) Sulla fognatura della città di Roma (Rome 1889).

Noy, D. (2000) Foreigners at Rome: citizens and strangers (London 2000).

Opalach, B. (1997) "Political space: the architecture of squatter settlements in São Paulo, Brazil", Traditional Dwellings and Settlements Review 9 (1997) 35-50.

Packer, J. E. (2013) "The Atlante: Roma antica revealed", Journal of Roman Archaeology 26 (2013) 553-61.

Panciera, S. (2003) "Umano, sovrumano o divino? Le divinità auguste e l'imperatore a Roma", in The representation and perception of Roman imperial power: proceedings of the third workshop of the International Network 'Impact of Empire' (Roman empire, c. 200 B.C. - A.D. 476); Netherlands Institute in Rome, March 20 23, 2002, ed. De Blois, L., Erdkamp, P. and Hekster, O. (Amsterdam 2003) 215-39.

Patterson, H., Witcher, R., Di Giuseppe, H. and Millett, M. (2020) (ed.) The changing landscape of Rome's northern hinterland: the British School at Rome's Tiber Valley Project (Oxford 2020).

Patterson, J. R. (2000) "On the margins of the city of Rome", in Death and disease in the ancient city, ed. Hope, V. M. and Marshall, E. (London 2000) 85-103.

Pergola, P., Santangeli Valenzani, R. and Volpe, R. (2003) (ed.) Suburbium: il suburbio di Roma dalla crisi del sistema delle ville a Gregorio Magno (Rome 2003).

Purcell, N. (1987) "Tomb and suburb", in Römische Gräberstraßen: Selbstdarstellung - Status - Standard, ed. Hesberg, H. v. and Zanker, P. (Munich 1987) 25-41.

--- (2007) "The horti of Rome and the landscape of property", in Res Bene Gestae: ricerche di storia urbana su Roma antica in onore di Eva Margareta Steinby, ed. Leone, A., Palombi, D. and Walker, S. (Rome 2007) 361-77.

Quilici, L. (1990) Le strade: viabilità tra Roma e Lazio (Roma 1990).

Rauws, W., de Roo, G. and Zhang, S. (2016) "Self-organisation and spatial planning: an editorial introduction", Town Planning Review 87 (2016) 241–51.

Restaino, G. (2012) Il suburbio di Roma: una storia cartografica - Rome's suburbio. A cartographic history (Rome 2012).

Ricci, C. (2005) Orbis in urbe: fenomeni migratori nella Roma imperiale (Roma 2005).

Schmidt, M. G. (2007) Corpus inscriptionum Latinarum (Berlin 2007).

Sinesi, D. (2014) (ed.) Luoghi ritrovati: La Collezione I di disegni e mappe dell’Archivio di Stato di Roma (secoli XVI - XIX) (Rome 2014).

Smith, C. (2017) "Ager romanus antiquus", Archeologia Classica 68 (2017) 1-26.

Speidel, M. P. (1994) Die Denkmäler der Kaiserreiter (Bonn 1994).

Spera, L. (1999) Il paesaggio suburbano di Roma dall'antichità al medioevo: il comprensorio tra le vie Latina e Ardeatina dalle Mura Aureliane al III miglio (Rome 1999).

Stöger, H. (2011) Rethinking Ostia: a spatial enquiry into the urban society of Rome's imperial port-town (Leiden 2011).

Tarpin, M. (2003) Vici et pagi dans l'Occident romain (Rome 2003).

Temin, P. (2006) "The economy of the early Roman empire", Journal of Economic Perspectives 20 (2006) 133-51.

Thrift, N. (1999) "The place of complexity", Theory, Culture & Society 16 (1999) 31-69.

Viitanen, E.-M. and Ynnilä, H. (2014) "Patrons and clients in Roman Pompeii: social control in the cityscape and city blocks?", in Sounds like theory. XII Nordic Theoretical Archaeology Group meeting in Oulu 25.-28.4.2012, ed. Ikäheimo, J., Salmi, A.-K. and Äikäs, T. (Helsinki 2014) 141-55.

Volpe, R. (2012) "Republican villas in the suburbium of Rome", in Roman republican villas: architecture, context, and ideology, ed. Becker, J. A. and Terrenato, N. (Ann Arbor, MI 2012) 94-110.

Wallace-Hadrill, A. (2008) Rome's cultural revolution (Cambridge, UK; New York 2008).

Wilson, A. (2000) "The water-mills on the Janiculum", Memoirs of the American Academy in Rome 45 (2000) 219-46.

--- (2003) "Late-antique water mills on the Janiculum", Papers of the British School at Rome 71 (2003) 85-109.

--- (2011) "City sizes and urbanization in the Roman empire", in Oxford studies on the Roman economy, ed. Bowman, A. K. and Wilson, A. (Oxford 2011) 161-96.

Witcher, R. (2005) "The extended metropolis: urbs, suburbium and population", Journal of Roman Archaeology 18 (2005) 120-38.

Witcher, R. (2006) "Settlement and society in early imperial Etruria", Journal of Roman Studies 96 (2006) 88-123.

--- (2013) "(Sub)urban surroundings", in The Cambridge companion to ancient Rome, ed. Erdkamp, P. (Cambridge 2013) 205-26.

Ziòlkowski, A. (2009) "Frontier sanctuaries of the ager Romanus antiquus: did they exist?", Palamedes 4 (2009) 91-130.
